string: The phosphotidylinositol-3 kinase/serine-threonine kinase ( AKT ) / mammalian target of rapamycin signaling pathway is frequently altered in non-small-cell lung cancer ( NSCLC ) .
label: background

string: PX-866 is an oral , irreversible , pan-isoform inhibitor of phosphotidylinositol-3 kinase .
label: background

string: Preclinical models revealed synergy with docetaxel and a phase 1 trial demonstrated tolerability of this combination .
label: background

string: This randomized phase 2 study evaluated PX-866 combined with docetaxel in patients with advanced , refractory NSCLC .
label: background

string: Patients with locally advanced , recurrent , or metastatic NSCLC who had received at least one and no more than two prior systemic treatment regimens were randomized ( 1:1 ) to a combination of docetaxel ( 75 mg/m intravenous every 21 days ) with or without PX-866 ( 8 mg orally daily ; arms A and B , respectively ) .
label: method

string: The primary end point was progression-free survival ( PFS ) .
label: method

string: Secondary end points included objective response rate , overall survival ( OS ) , toxicity , and correlation of biomarker analyses with efficacy outcomes .
label: method

string: A total of 95 patients were enrolled .
label: result

string: Median PFS was 2 months in arm A and 2.9 months in arm B ( p = 0.65 ) .
label: result

string: Objective response rates were 6 % and 0 % in arms A and B , respectively ( p = 0.4 ) .
label: result

string: There was no difference in OS between the two arms ( 7.0 versus 9.2 months ; p = 0.9 ) .
label: result

string: Grade 3 or higher adverse events were infrequent , but more common in the combination arm with respect to diarrhea ( 7 % versus 2 % ) , nausea ( 4 % versus 0 % ) , and vomiting ( 7 % versus 0 % ) .
label: result

string: PIK3CA mutations or PTEN loss were infrequently observed .
label: result

string: A total of 637 patients with refractory or sensitive SCLC were randomly assigned at a ratio of 2:1 to 21-day cycles of amrubicin 40 mg/m ( 2 ) intravenously ( IV ) on days 1 to 3 or topotecan 1.5 mg/m ( 2 ) IV on days 1 to 5 .
label: method

string: Primary end point was overall survival ( OS ) ; secondary end points included overall response rate ( ORR ) , progression-free survival ( PFS ) , and safety .
label: method

string: Median OS was 7.5 months with amrubicin versus 7.8 months with topotecan ( hazard ratio [ HR ] , 0.880 ; P = .170 ) ; in refractory patients , median OS was 6.2 and 5.7 months , respectively ( HR , 0.77 ; P = .047 ) .
label: result

string: Median PFS was 4.1 months with amrubicin and 3.5 months with topotecan ( HR , 0.802 ; P = .018 ) .
label: result

string: ORR was 31.1 % with amrubicin and 16.9 % with topotecan ( odds ratio , 2.223 ; P < .001 ) .
label: result

string: Grade 3 treatment-emergent adverse events in the amrubicin and topotecan arms were : neutropenia ( 41 % v 54 % ; P = .004 ) , thrombocytopenia ( 21 % v 54 % ; P < .001 ) , anemia ( 16 % v 31 % ; P < .001 ) , infections ( 16 % v 10 % ; P = .043 ) , febrile neutropenia ( 10 % v 3 % ; P = .003 ) , and cardiac disorders ( 5 % v 5 % ; P = .759 ) ; transfusion rates were 32 % and 53 % ( P < .001 ) , respectively .
label: result

string: NQO1 polymorphisms did not influence safety outcomes .
label: result

string: In this randomized , double-blinded , placebo-controlled study , we screened 272 participants , and ultimately enrolled 200 into the study .
label: method

string: These 200 participants were randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to receive acid inhibitors ( esomeprazole , treatment group , n = 100 ; dose ,20 mg/d ) or matched placebo ( control group , n = 100 ) for 3 days post-gastroscopic mucosal biopsy .
label: method

string: The presence of abdominal pain was observed pre-and post-gastroscopy , and the therapeutic effect of esomeprazole was assessed .
label: method

string: This study was registered at the Chinese clinical trial registry as ChiCTR-TRC-00000500 .
label: method

string: Ten subjects were lost to followup ( 4 in treatment group ; 6 in the control group ) .
label: result

string: There was no significant difference in the number of subjects with aggravating abdominal pain ( treatment 29.2 % vs. control 22.3 % ; p > 0.05 ) between the two groups .
label: result

string: Esomeprazole did not significantly ( p > 0.05 ) affect the rate of abdominal pain within 24 h ( treatment 27.1 % vs. control 19.1 % ) , 48 h ( treatment 40.6 % vs. control 27.7 % ) , and 96 h ( treatment 43.8 % vs. control 34.0 % ) on abdominal pain in all in the evaluated subjects .
label: result

string: Between the two groups however , a statistically significant difference ( p < 0.05 ) was found on overall effective treatment rates at 48 h ( treatment 92.9 % vs. control 66.7 % ) and at 96 h ( treatment 100 % vs. control 81 % ) in the subjects with worsened abdominal pain .
label: result

string: The primary endpoint was significantly reduced by prasugrel in the overall NSTE-ACS population ( hazard ratio ( HR ) 0.82 , 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 0.73-0 .93 , p = 0.002 ) as well as in unstable angina ( UA ) and in non-ST elevation myocardial infarction ( NSTEMI ) patient subgroups ( interaction p value = 0.39 ) .
label: result

string: Although non-coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) TIMI major bleeding was increased with prasugrel as compared with clopidogrel ( HR 1.40 , 95 % CI 1.05-1 .88 , p = 0.02 ) , there was a net clinical benefit in patients assigned to prasugrel ( HR 0.89 , 95 % CI 0.80-1 .00 , p = 0.043 ) , which was consistent for UA and NSTEMI subgroups ( interaction p value = 0.84 and 0.72 ) .
label: result

string: In patients who met the criteria for prasugrel use recommended by the European Medicines Agency , thus excluding from the analysis patients with prior transient ischemic attack ( TIA ) / stroke , with weight < 60 kg or age 75 years , and censoring follow-up at 365 days , ( European Union ( EU ) - label cohort ) prasugrel showed superiority over clopidogrel with regard to the primary endpoint ( HR 0.73 , 95 % CI 0.63-0 .85 , p < 0.0001 ) for the entire NSTE-ACS population , as well as for UA patients and NSTEMI patients without significant differences in non-CABG TIMI major bleeding .
label: result

string: Juvenile Cerebral Palsy -- is caused by damage of the motor control centers of the developing brain ( cerebral refers to the cerebrum , which is the affected area of the brain , although the disorder probably involves connections between the cortex and other parts of the brain and palsy refers to disorder of movement ) .
label: background

string: The clinical symptoms of juvenile cerebral palsy are very diversified and include gross and fine motor-coordination disorders , manual ability , locomotion , perception and response , speech , psychomotor retardation , emotional disorders .
label: background

string: The primary therapeutic problem in children with cerebral palsy is learning to move in a lower position and learning to walk .
label: background

string: The aim of this research is evaluation the action of the botulinum toxin on gait pattern of children with cerebral palsy .
label: background

string: Application of a comprehensive BTS analysis of gait will get accurate , consistent EBM ( Evidence Base Medicine ) results .
label: background

string: The children with pyramidal syndrome of juvenile cerebral palsy have been included in the examinations .
label: method

string: The children have been divided into 2 random groups : group I -- children treated with standard therapy a neurodevelopmental rehabilitation and classic kinesiotherapy , group II -- hildren treated with standard therapy -- eurodevelopmental rehabilitation , classic kinesiotherapy and a botulinum toxin .
label: method

string: The children were examined three times : before the therapy , after 6 weeks of treatment and after 3 months of treatment .
label: method

string: In the research BTS comprehensive motion analysis system have been used where influence of toxin botulin on walk stereotype of children was assessed .
label: method

string: The treatment connected with standard rehabilitation and using botulinum toxin brings quicker walk improvement .
label: result

string: Comparing the above treatment methods of influence on the walk stereotype of children with juvenile cerebral palsy , we can confirm , that standard treatment brings regular improvement , still , it requires longer period of time , often even 3 months .
label: result

string: Using botulinum toxin brings quicker walk improvement , after 6 weeks only , which is a clear , but short-term result .
label: result

string: Limited data exist regarding the efficacy of metoclopramide in the treatment of intractable hiccups .
label: background

string: A total of 36 patients with intractable hiccups was randomly assigned to arm A ( n = 18 ) or arm B ( n = 18 ) in a multicentre , double-blind , randomised , controlled pilot study .
label: method

string: Participants in arm A received 10-mg metoclopramide thrice daily for 15 days , whereas those assigned to arm B received 10-mg placebo thrice daily for 15 days .
label: method

string: The primary outcome measure was total efficacy against hiccups ( including cessation and improvement of hiccups ) .
label: method

string: Secondary outcome measures included a comparison of overall efficacy and adverse events between the two arms .
label: method

string: Of the 36 patients enrolled , 34 participants completed the study .
label: result

string: The total efficacy was higher in arm A than in arm B ( relative risk , 2.75 ; 95 % confidence interval : 1.09-6 .94 , P = 0.03 ) .
label: result

string: Furthermore , comparison between the two arms revealed that overall efficacy was higher in arm A than that in arm B ( P < 0.05 ) .
label: result

string: No serious adverse events related to the treatment were documented in either arm .
label: result

string: The most common adverse events occurring in patients in arm A included fatigue , upset mood and dizziness .
label: result

string: Fifteen CI listeners took part in an auditory phoneme-based computer training program .
label: method

string: Before and after training , speech recognition tests in moderate and difficult noise ( +5 dB SNR and 0 dB SNR , respectively ) were administered .
label: method

string: Additionally , speech recognition was tested 6 months after the training ( follow-up ) .
label: method

string: A control group consisting of 12 subjects underwent audiometric testing without any auditory training .
label: method

string: Speech perception in moderate noise improved significantly during the training as revealed by comparing pre - and posttraining scores evaluated in the moderate noise condition .
label: result

string: No significant change was observed for the difficult noise situation at 0 dB SNR .
label: result

string: The speech perception measures of the control group remained unchanged .
label: result

string: No significant effect of age on the training effect was observed .
label: result

string: Abdominal pain is commonly reported by youth with IBD .
label: background

string: In a significant subset of youth , pain severity and pain catastrophizing ( i.e. , unhelpful thoughts related to the pain ) may contribute to more negative outcomes and greater impairment in functioning .
label: background

string: This study aimed to examine relationships of pain severity and pain catastrophizing with functional disability among a sample of youth with inflammatory bowel disease ( IBD ) .
label: background

string: Seventy-five youth aged 11 to 18 years completed ratings of abdominal pain severity , pain catastrophizing , and functional disability using validated measures .
label: method

string: Disease activity was rated by treating physicians .
label: method

string: Over half of participants reported abdominal pain in the past two weeks , and pain was present among those with and without clinical disease activity .
label: result

string: Nearly one-third of youth reported mild to moderate functional disability .
label: result

string: After controlling for gender , pain severity accounted for 15 % of the variance in patient functional disability .
label: result

string: Moreover , pain catastrophizing contributed significant variance to the prediction of functional disability ( approximately 7 % ) beyond the role of pain severity .
label: result

string: A parallel group , randomized clinical trial with blinded outcome assessment at 2 hospitals in Edinburgh , Scotland , of 240 patients discharged from the ICU between December 1 , 2010 , and January 31 , 2013 , who required at least 48 hours of mechanical ventilation .
label: method

string: Analysis for the primary outcome and other 3-month outcomes was performed between June and August 2013 ; for the 6 - and 12-month outcomes and the health economic evaluation , between March and April 2014 .
label: method

string: During the post-ICU hospital stay , both groups received physiotherapy and dietetic , occupational , and speech/language therapy , but patients in the intervention group received rehabilitation that typically increased the frequency of mobility and exercise therapies 2 - to 3-fold , increased dietetic assessment and treatment , used individualized goal setting , and provided greater illness-specific information .
label: method

string: Intervention group therapy was coordinated and delivered by a dedicated rehabilitation practitioner .
label: method

string: The Rivermead Mobility Index ( RMI ) ( range 0-15 ) at 3 months ; higher scores indicate greater mobility .
label: method

string: Secondary outcomes included HRQOL , psychological outcomes , self-reported symptoms , patient experience , and cost-effectiveness during a 12-month follow-up ( completed in February 2014 ) .
label: method

string: Median RMI at randomization was 3 ( interquartile range [ IQR ] , 1-6 ) and at 3 months was 13 ( IQR , 10-14 ) for the intervention and usual care groups ( mean difference , -0.2 [ 95 % CI , -1.3 to 0.9 ; P = .71 ] ) .
label: result

string: The HRQOL scores were unchanged by the intervention ( mean difference in the Physical Component Summary score , -0.1 [ 95 % CI , -3.3 to 3.1 ; P = .96 ] ; and in the Mental Component Summary score , 0.2 [ 95 % CI , -3.4 to 3.8 ; P = .91 ] ) .
label: result

string: No differences were found for self-reported symptoms of fatigue , pain , appetite , joint stiffness , or breathlessness .
label: result

string: Levels of anxiety , depression , and posttraumatic stress were similar , as were hand grip strength and the timed Up & Go test .
label: result

string: No differences were found at the 6 - or 12-month follow-up for any outcome measures .
label: result

string: However , patients in the intervention group reported greater satisfaction with physiotherapy , nutritional support , coordination of care , and information provision .
label: result

string: isrctn.com Identifier : ISRCTN09412438 .
label: background

string: 100 patients undergoing elective coronary artery bypass graft surgery is divided into two groups .
label: method

string: In group I ( low dose ) , anesthesia was induced with propofol 1-2 .5 mg/kg and fentanyl 2 mcg/kg , in group II ( high dose ) fentanyl 40-70 mcg/kg was used .
label: method

string: In group I , propofol 5-10 mg/kg/h , fentanyl 1-3 mcg/kg/h , in group II fentanyl 5-10 mcg/kg/h was used for maintenance of anesthesia .
label: method

string: The tactile and thermal thresholds were measured before surgery and in 1st , 3rd and 7th postoperative days by using Von Frey filaments and a thermal source , respectively .
label: method

string: Tactile thresholds were significantly decreased at the first ( 6,080.21 and 3.760.13 g ; p < 0.001 ) and third ( 6.760.24 and 4.960.16 g ; p < 0.001 ) postoperative days compared to baseline preoperative values ( 7.720.26 , and 7.600.21 g ; p = 816 ) in two groups .
label: result

string: Postoperative 1st ( 13.450.33 and 10.050.24 sec ; p < 0.001 ) and 3rd day ( 14.770.28 and 13.170.26 sec ; p < 0.001 ) assessments showed a statistically significant thermal hyperalgesia compared to the preoperative baseline values ( 16.670.51 and 16.450.42 sec ; p = 0.997 ) in two groups .
label: result

string: This decrease in both tactile and thermal thresholds returned to baseline control values at the 7th day of measurement .

string: Secondary analysis of data from a randomized placebo-controlled trial of daily oral tenofovir and emtricitabine/tenofovir PrEP among heterosexual Kenyan and Ugandan HIV-1 serodiscordant couples .
label: method

string: PrEP efficacy for HIV-1 prevention was compared among HIV-1-uninfected women using DMPA versus no hormonal contraception and among HIV-1 uninfected men whose HIV-1-infected female partners used DMPA versus no hormonal contraception .
label: method

string: Of 4747 HIV-1 serodiscordant couples , 901 HIV-1-uninfected women used DMPA at some point during follow-up , 1422 HIV-1-uninfected women used no hormonal contraception , 1568 HIV-1-uninfected men had female partners who used DMPA , and 2626 men had female partners who used no hormonal contraception .
label: result

string: PrEP efficacy estimates for HIV-1 prevention , compared with placebo , were similar among women using DMPA and those using no hormonal contraception ( 64.7 and 75.5 % , adjusted interaction P = 0.65 ) .
label: result

string: Similarly , for men whose female partners used DMPA , PrEP efficacy did not differ from men whose partners used no hormonal contraception ( 90.0 versus 81.7 % , adjusted interaction P = 0.52 ) .
label: result

string: We performed a 6-month , multicenter , double-blind , randomized , placebo-controlled clinical trial .
label: method

string: The recruitment period was from November 2008 to December 2011 .
label: method

string: The sample comprised 90 patients with a diagnosis of schizophrenia ( DSM-IV criteria ) who exhibited negative symptoms .
label: method

string: The patients were recruited from 10 centers in different cities of the Spanish State .
label: method

string: The primary efficacy measure was change in score on the negative subscale of the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale ( PANSS ) between baseline and 6-month assessment .
label: method

string: Other efficacy measures were changes in the PANSS subscales and total score , as well as the Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms ( SANS ) subscales and total score .
label: method

string: For statistical analysis , we employed mixed-effects models .
label: result

string: We did not find statistically significant differences between the placebo group and the 2 treatment groups at 6-month assessments for the PANSS total ( P = .6511 ) , any PANSS subscale ( negative [ P = .5533 ] , positive [ P = .1723 ] , or general psychopathology [ P = .2083 ] ) , or the SANS ( P = .5884 ) .
label: result

string: Cohen d measure showed a small effect size below the 0.5 threshold for all comparisons .
label: result

string: ClinicalTrials.gov identifier : NCT01300364 .
label: background

string: Data were pooled from five RCTs examining vildagliptin ( n = 2,788 ) and sulfonylureas ( glimepiride [ n = 1,259 ] or gliclazide [ n = 433 ] ) , added to metformin .
label: method

string: For real-life conditions , data were extracted from an observational study examining vildagliptin ( n = 7,002 ) or sulfonylureas ( n = 3,702 ) , added to metformin monotherapy .
label: method

string: Linear regression analyses were performed between the baseline HbA1c and the change in HbA1c ( HbA1c ) after 24 weeks .
label: method

string: Baseline HbA1c correlated to HbA1c ( r ( 2 ) = 0.36 , slope = -0.54 [ 95 % CI -0.55 , -0.53 ; p < 0.0001 ] ) for both treatments .
label: result

string: With sulfonylureas , the slope of the correlation was steeper in the observational study than in RCTs ( interaction coefficient = -0.327 , p < 0.001 ) , whereas for vildagliptin , the slope was virtually identical in the observational study and the RCTs ( interaction coefficient = 0.024 , p = 0.175 ) .
label: result

string: For any given baseline HbA1c , HbA1c with sulfonylureas was smaller in real life than in RCTs , whereas HbA1c with vildagliptin was the same .
label: result

string: Randomized clinical trial of supplementation with either daily multivitamins ( B vitamins and vitamins C and E ) , selenium alone , or multivitamins with selenium vs placebo in a factorial design for 24 months .
label: method

string: The study was conducted in 878 patients infected with HIV subtype C with a CD4 cell count greater than 350/L who were not receiving ART at Princess Marina Hospital in Gaborone , Botswana , between December 2004 and July 2009 .
label: method

string: Daily oral supplements of B vitamins and vitamins C and E , selenium alone , or multivitamins plus selenium , compared with placebo .
label: method

string: Reaching a CD4 cell count less than 200/L until May 2008 ; after this date , reaching a CD4 cell count of 250/L or less , consistent with the standard of care in Botswana for initiation of ART at the time of the study .
label: method

string: There were 878 participants enrolled and randomized into the study .
label: result

string: All participants were ART-naive throughout the study .
label: result

string: In intent-to-treat analysis , participants receiving the combined supplement of multivitamins plus selenium had a significantly lower risk vs placebo of reaching CD4 cell count 250/L or less ( adjusted hazard ratio [ HR ] , 0.46 ; 95 % CI , 0.25-0 .85 ; P = .01 ; absolute event rate [ AER ] , 4.79 / 100 person-years ; censoring rate , 0.92 ; 17 events ; placebo AER , 9.22 / 100 person-years ; censoring rate , 0.85 ; 32 events ) .
label: result

string: Multivitamins plus selenium in a single supplement , vs placebo , also reduced the risk of secondary events of combined outcomes for disease progression ( CD4 cell count 250/L , AIDS-defining conditions , or AIDS-related death , whichever occurred earlier [ adjusted HR , 0.56 ; 95 % CI , 0.33-0 .95 ; P = .03 ; AER , 6.48 / 100 person-years ; censoring rate , 0.90 ; 23 events ] ) .
label: result

string: There was no effect of supplementation on HIV viral load .
label: result

string: Multivitamins alone and selenium supplementation alone were not statistically different from placebo for any end point .
label: result

string: Reported adverse events were adjudicated as unlikely to be related to the intervention , and there were no notable differences in incidence of HIV-related and health-related events among study groups .
label: result

string: Intermittent preventive treatment in pregnancy ( IPTp ) with sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine ( SP ) is recommended by WHO to prevent malaria in African pregnant women .
label: background

string: The spread of SP parasite resistance has raised concerns regarding long-term use for IPT .
label: background

string: Mefloquine ( MQ ) is the most promising of available alternatives to SP based on safety profile , long half-life , and high efficacy in Africa .
label: background

string: We evaluated the safety and efficacy of MQ for IPTp compared to those of SP in HIV-negative women .
label: background

string: A total of 4,749 pregnant women were enrolled in an open-label randomized clinical trial conducted in Benin , Gabon , Mozambique , and Tanzania comparing two-dose MQ or SP for IPTp and MQ tolerability of two different regimens .
label: result

string: The study arms were : ( 1 ) SP , ( 2 ) single dose MQ ( 15 mg/kg ) , and ( 3 ) split-dose MQ in the context of long lasting insecticide treated nets .
label: result

string: There was no difference on low birth weight prevalence ( primary study outcome ) between groups ( 360/2 ,778 [ 13.0 % ] ) for MQ group and 177/1 ,398 ( 12.7 % ) for SP group ; risk ratio [ RR ] , 1.02 ( 95 % CI 0.86-1 .22 ; p = 0.80 in the ITT analysis ) .
label: result

string: Women receiving MQ had reduced risks of parasitemia ( 63/1 ,372 [ 4.6 % ] in the SP group and 88/2 ,737 [ 3.2 % ] in the MQ group ; RR , 0.70 [ 95 % CI 0.51-0 .96 ] ; p = 0.03 ) and anemia at delivery ( 609/1 ,380 [ 44.1 % ] in the SP group and 1,110 / 2743 [ 40.5 % ] in the MQ group ; RR , 0.92 [ 95 % CI 0.85-0 .99 ] ; p = 0.03 ) , and reduced incidence of clinical malaria ( 96/551 .8 malaria episodes person/year [ PYAR ] in the SP group and 130/1 ,103.2 episodes PYAR in the MQ group ; RR , 0.67 [ 95 % CI 0.52-0 .88 ] ; p = 0.004 ) and all-cause outpatient attendances during pregnancy ( 850/557 .8 outpatients visits PYAR in the SP group and 1,480 / 1,110.1 visits PYAR in the MQ group ; RR , 0.86 [ 0.78-0 .95 ] ; p = 0.003 ) .
label: result

string: There were no differences in the prevalence of placental infection and adverse pregnancy outcomes between groups .
label: result

string: Tolerability was poorer in the two MQ groups compared to SP .
label: result

string: The most frequently reported related adverse events were dizziness ( ranging from 33.9 % to 35.5 % after dose 1 ; and 16.0 % to 20.8 % after dose 2 ) and vomiting ( 30.2 % to 31.7 % , after dose 1 and 15.3 % to 17.4 % after dose 2 ) with similar proportions in the full and split MQ arms .
label: result

string: The open-label design is a limitation of the study that affects mainly the safety assessment .
label: result

string: ClinicalTrials.gov NCT 00811421 ; Pan African Clinical Trials Registry PACTR 2010020001429343 Please see later in the article for the Editors ' Summary .
label: background

string: Repeated nicotine exposure causes neuroadaptations in limbic cortico-striatal circuits involved in learning and motivation .
label: background

string: Such alterations are relevant to addiction because they are suggested to mediate the ability of smoking-associated stimuli to control behavior and to enhance nicotine-seeking and - taking behaviors .
label: background

string: Female smokers report higher cue reactivity relative to their male counter parts , yet little is known about putative gender-specific effects of adolescent nicotine exposure on reward-related learning .
label: background

string: Prior repeated nicotine exposure in adult male rats enhances Pavlovian approach behavior and conditioned reinforcement .
label: background

string: Rats were injected with nicotine on postnatal days 31-45 prior to training on Pavlovian approach behavior starting on day 51 .
label: method

string: They were trained to associate a conditioned stimulus ( CS ) , illumination of a magazine light , and tone , with an unconditioned stimulus ( US ) , the delivery of water , for 10-daily sessions , and then were tested on the acquisition of responding with conditioned reinforcement .
label: method

string: Adolescent nicotine exposure selectively increased approach to the magazine during the CS in males but decreased approach to the magazine during the CS in female rats .
label: result

string: Vehicle-exposed female rats , however , showed greater magazine approach during the CS than did male control rats .
label: result

string: Prior nicotine exposure also enhanced conditioned reinforcement in both male and female rats .
label: result

string: A small , multicenter , randomized , double-masked , placebo-controlled 56-day phase 2 clinical trial including a 28-day follow-up at 2 US sites .
label: method

string: Nine patients with severe dry eye were treated with either RGN-259 ( 0.1 % ) or vehicle control 6 times daily over a period of 28 days .
label: method

string: Dry eye sign and symptom assessments , such as ocular discomfort ( using the OSDI questionnaire ) and corneal fluorescein staining ( using the NEI workshop grading system ) , were evaluated at various time points .
label: method

string: Statistically significant differences in both symptom and sign assessments , were seen at various time points throughout the study .
label: result

string: Of particular note at day 56 , the RGN-259-treated group ( 12 eyes ) had 35.1 % reduction of ocular discomfort compared with vehicle control ( 6 eyes ) ( P = 0.0141 ) , and 59.1 % reduction of total corneal fluorescein staining compared with vehicle control ( P = 0.0108 ) .
label: result

string: Other improvements seen in the RGN-259-treated patients included tear film breakup time and increased tear volume production .
label: result

string: Angina affects more than 50 million people worldwide .
label: background

string: Secondary prevention interventions such as cardiac rehabilitation are not widely available for this population .
label: background

string: An Internet-based version could offer a feasible alternative .
label: background

string: We conducted a randomized controlled trial , recruiting those diagnosed with angina from general practitioners ( GPs ) in primary care to an intervention or control group .
label: method

string: Intervention group participants were offered a 6-week Web-based rehabilitation program ( `` ActivateYourHeart '' ) .
label: method

string: The program was introduced during a face-to-face appointment and then delivered via the Internet ( no further face-to-face contact ) .
label: method

string: The program contained information about the secondary prevention of coronary heart disease ( CHD ) and set each user goals around physical activity , diet , managing emotions , and smoking .
label: method

string: Performance against goals was reviewed throughout the program and goals were then reset/modified .
label: method

string: Participants completed an online exercise diary and communicated with rehabilitation specialists through an email link/synchronized chat room .
label: method

string: Participants in the control group continued with GP treatment as usual , which consisted of being placed on a CHD register and attending an annual review .
label: method

string: Outcomes were measured at 6-week and 6-month follow-ups during face-to-face assessments .
label: method

string: The primary outcome measure was change in daily steps at 6 weeks , measured using an accelerometer .
label: method

string: Secondary outcome measures were energy expenditure ( EE ) , duration of sedentary activity ( DSA ) , duration of moderate activity ( DMA ) , weight , diastolic/systolic blood pressure , and body fat percentage .
label: method

string: Self-assessed questionnaire outcomes included fat/fiber intake , anxiety/depression , self-efficacy , and quality of life ( QOL ) .
label: method

string: A total of 94 participants were recruited and randomized to the intervention ( n = 48 ) or the usual care ( n = 46 ) group ; 84 and 73 participants completed the 6-week and 6-month follow-ups , respectively .
label: result

string: The mean number of log-ins to the program was 18.68 ( SD 13.13 , range 1-51 ) , an average of 3 log-ins per week per participant .
label: result

string: Change in daily steps walked at the 6-week follow-up was +497 ( SD 2171 ) in the intervention group and -861 ( SD 2534 ) in the control group ( 95 % CI 263-2451 , P = .02 ) .
label: result

string: Significant intervention effects were observed at the 6-week follow-up in EE ( +43.94 kcal , 95 % CI 43.93-309 .98 , P = .01 ) , DSA ( -7.79 minutes , 95 % CI -55.01 to -7.01 , P = .01 ) , DMA ( +6.31 minutes , 95 % CI 6.01-51 .20 , P = .01 ) , weight ( -0.56 kg , 95 % CI -1.78 to -0.15 , P = .02 ) , self-efficacy ( 95 % CI 0.30-4 .79 , P = .03 ) , emotional QOL score ( 95 % CI 0.01-0 .54 , P = .04 ) , and angina frequency ( 95 % CI 8.57-35 .05 , P = .002 ) .
label: result

string: Significant benefits in angina frequency ( 95 % CI 1.89-29 .41 , P = .02 ) and social QOL score ( 95 % CI 0.05-0 .54 , P = .02 ) were also observed at the 6-month follow-up .
label: result

string: International Standard Randomized Controlled Trial Number ( ISRCTN ) : 90110503 ; http://www.controlled-trials.com/ISRCTN90110503/ISRCTN90110503 ( Archived by WebCite at http://www.webcitation.org/6RYVOQFKM ) .
label: background

string: Prosthetic reconstruction of the breast , as a 2-staged procedure using tissue expanders followed by placement of permanent implants , offers favorable aesthetic results with minimal additional surgical intervention .
label: background

string: However , the current outpatient process to fill saline expanders can be lengthy and onerous , involving months of office visits and discomfort from the bolus saline expansions .
label: background

string: We present a new technology ( AeroForm Tissue Expansion System ) , which has the potential to improve the process of breast tissue expansion by providing a method for low-volume incremental filling , eliminating the need for injections and directly involving the patient by allowing her some control over the expansion process .
label: background

string: The described study is a 2:1 randomized controlled trial of the investigational CO2 expansion system and saline expanders .
label: method

string: Of the 82 women receiving expanders , 58 ( 39 bilateral and 19 unilateral ; bilateral rate , 67 % ) were implanted with CO2 tissue expanders and 24 subjects ( 15 bilateral and 9 unilateral ; bilateral rate , 63 % ) were implanted with saline expanders .
label: method

string: Preliminary validated expansion results were available for 55 women .
label: result

string: Available mean time for active expansion in the CO2 group was 18.2 ( 9.2 ) days ( median , 14.0 ; range , 5-39 ; number of expanders , 53 ) , which was less than the mean time for active expansion in the saline group : 57.4 ( 33.6 ) days ( median , 55 ; range , 5-137 ; number of expanders , 33 ) .
label: result

string: Available mean time from implant placement to exchange for a permanent prosthesis in the CO2 group was shorter [ 106.3 ( 42.9 ) days ; median , 99 ; range , 42-237 ; number of expanders , 53 ] than for the women in the control group [ 151.7 ( 62.6 ) days ; median , 140 ; range , 69-433 ; number of expanders , 33 ] .
label: result

string: After 2 events -- underexpansion ( n = 1 ) and erosion ( n = 1 ) -- in the CO2 group , the internal membrane was redesigned and the expander bulk was decreased to minimize the risk of underexpansion and erosion in subsequent patients .
label: result

string: Many older adults are both highly sedentary ( that is , spend considerable amounts of time sitting ) and physically inactive ( that is , do little physical activity ) .
label: background

string: This protocol describes an exploratory trial of a theory-based behaviour change intervention in the form of a booklet outlining simple activities ( ` tips ' ) designed both to reduce sedentary behaviour and to increase physical activity in older adults .
label: background

string: The intervention is based on the ` habit formation ' model , which proposes that consistent repetition leads to behaviour becoming automatic , sustaining activity gains over time .
label: background

string: The intervention is being developed iteratively , in line with Medical Research Council complex intervention guidelines .
label: method

string: Selection of activity tips was informed by semi-structured interviews and focus groups with older adults , and input from a multidisciplinary expert panel .
label: method

string: An ongoing preliminary field test of acceptability among 25 older adults will inform further refinement .
label: method

string: An exploratory randomized controlled trial will be conducted within a primary care setting , comparing the tips booklet with a control fact sheet .
label: method

string: Retired , inactive and sedentary adults ( n = 120 ) aged 60 to 74 years , with no physical impairments precluding light physical activity , will be recruited from general practices in north London , UK .
label: method

string: The primary outcomes are recruitment and attrition rates .
label: method

string: Secondary outcomes are changes in behaviour , habit , health and wellbeing over 12 weeks .
label: method

string: Current Controlled Trials ISRCTN47901994 .
label: background

string: Targeted genotyping was performed across study sites for AMD and lipid trait-associated single nucleotide polymorphism ( SNPs ) .
label: method

string: Genetic association tests were performed at individual sites and then meta-analyzed using logistic regression assuming an additive genetic model stratified by self-described race/ethnicity .
label: method

string: Participants included cases with early or late AMD and controls with no signs of AMD as determined by fundus photography .
label: method

string: Populations included in this study were European Americans , African Americans , Mexican Americans , and Singaporeans from the Population Architecture using Genomics and Epidemiology ( PAGE ) study .
label: method

string: Index variants of AMD , rs1061170 ( CFH ) and rs10490924 ( ARMS2 ) , were associated with AMD at P = 3.0510 ( -8 ) and P = 6.3610 ( -6 ) , respectively , in European Americans .
label: result

string: In general , none of the major AMD index variants generalized to our non-European populations with the exception of rs10490924 in Mexican Americans at an uncorrected P value < 0.05 .
label: result

string: Four lipid-associated SNPS ( LPL rs328 , TRIB1 rs6987702 , CETP rs1800775 , and KCTD10/MVK rs2338104 ) were associated with AMD in African Americans and Mexican Americans ( P < 0.05 ) , but these associations did not survive strict corrections for multiple testing .
label: result

string: A functional polymorphism ( 5-HTTLPR ) in the promoter region of the serotonin transporter gene has been widely studied as a risk factor and moderator of treatment for a variety of psychopathologic conditions .
label: background

string: To evaluate whether 5-HTTLPR moderates the effects of treatment to reduce heavy drinking , we studied 112 high-functioning European-American men who have sex with men ( MSM ) .
label: background

string: Subjects participated in a randomized clinical trial of naltrexone ( NTX ) and cognitive behavioral therapy ( CBT ) for problem drinking .
label: background

string: Subjects were treated for 12 weeks with 100 mg/d of oral NTX or placebo ( PBO ) .
label: method

string: All participants received medical management with adjusted brief behavioral compliance enhancement treatment ( BBCET ) alone or in combination with modified behavioral self-control therapy ( MBSCT ; an amalgam of motivational interviewing and CBT ) .
label: method

string: Participants were genotyped for the tri-allelic 5-HTTLPR polymorphism ( i.e. , low-activity S ' or high-activity L' alleles ) .
label: method

string: During treatment , the number of weekly heavy drinking days ( HDD ; defined as 5 or more standard drinks per day ) was significantly lower in subjects with the L' L' ( N = 26 , p = 0.015 ) or L 'S ' ( N = 52 , p = 0.016 ) genotype than those with the S 'S ' ( N = 34 ) genotype regardless of treatment type .
label: result

string: There was a significant interaction of genotype with treatment : For subjects with the S 'S ' genotype , the effects of MBSCT or NTX on HDD were significantly greater than the minimal intervention ( i.e. , BBCET or PBO , p = 0.007 and p = 0.049 , respectively ) .
label: result

string: In contrast , for subjects with 1 or 2 L' alleles , the effects of the more intensive psychosocial treatment ( MBSCT ) or NTX did not significantly differ from BBCET or PBO .
label: result

string: The anterolateral approach is a commonly used technique for total hip replacement .
label: background

string: It requires the detachment of a large part of the gluteus medius muscle .
label: background

string: However , it is known that this muscle has a great impact on hip stability .
label: background

string: Using the percutaneous assisted approach the damage to the gluteus medius can be limited .
label: background

string: The purpose of this study is to compare the effect of the percutaneous assisted approach with the anterolateral approach on postoperative functional outcome .
label: background

string: This study uses a prospective , randomized , parallel-group design with blinded assessment and unblinded treatment to compare the percutaneous assisted approach with the anterolateral approach in total hip replacement surgery .
label: method

string: The postoperative results of patients operated on using the percutaneous assisted approach will be compared with those of patients operated on using the anterolateral approach .
label: method

string: Prior to surgery patients will undergo baseline measurements .
label: method

string: These will consist of gluteus medius measurements ( surface-electromyography , strength measurements of abductors and quadriceps and the Trendelenburg test ) , questionnaires ( Oxford Hip Score and 36-item Short Form Health Survey ) and functional measures ( the Timed Get-Up-and-Go test , Five times Sit-to-Stand test and Six-Minute Walk test ) .
label: method

string: These measurements will be repeated four and 12 weeks after surgery .
label: method

string: After surgery both groups will receive usual care .
label: method

string: This trial was registered with ClinicalTrials.gov on 8 January 2014 , registration number : NCT02032017 .
label: background

string: Mineralocorticoid receptor antagonists reduce morbidity and mortality in patients with heart failure but can cause hyperkalemia , which contributes to reduced use of these drugs .
label: background

string: Hypokalemia also leads to worse outcomes in patients with heart failure and may be attenuated by mineralocorticoid receptor antagonists .
label: background

string: We assessed incidence and predictors of hyperkalemia ( potassium 5.5 mmol/L ) and hypokalemia ( potassium < 3.5 mmol/L ) and the relationship to outcomes in 1663 patients with class III or IV heart failure and left ventricular ejection fraction < 35 % randomized to treatment with spironolactone 25 mg or placebo in the Randomized Aldactone Evaluation Study ( RALES ) trial .
label: result

string: All-cause mortality rates and the influence of potassium levels on the effectiveness of spironolactone were assessed in a landmark analysis and in relation to time-varying potassium levels .
label: result

string: After 1 month , mean potassium levels increased in the spironolactone group but not in the placebo group ( 4.540.49 versus 4.280.50 mmol/L ; P < 0.001 ) and remained elevated during the trial .
label: result

string: Although the extremes of hypokalemia and hyperkalemia at 4 weeks were associated with increased risk of mortality in both treatment arms , participants in the spironolactone arm had lower mortality rates at all potassium levels throughout the duration of the trial .
label: result

string: The treatment benefit of spironolactone was maintained at least until potassium exceeded 5.5 mmol/L .
label: result

string: Preterm infants ( birth weight 500-1249g ) were randomized to receive parenteral nutrition with MOSF ( 30 % Medium-chain triglycerides , 25 % Olive oil , 30 % Soybean oil , 15 % Fish oil ) or S ( S , 100 % Soybean oil ) both at two levels of fat intake : 2.5 or 3.5 gkg ( -1 ) d ( -1 ) , named 2.5 Fat and 3.5 Fat respectively .
label: method

string: Plasma lipid classes and their fatty acid composition were determined on postnatal day 7 and 14 by gas chromatography together with routine biochemistry .
label: method

string: We studied 80 infants .
label: result

string: MOSF infants had significantly higher plasma phospholipid Docosahexaenoic acid and Eicosapentaenoic and lower Arachidonic acid .
label: result

string: Plasma phospholipids , triglycerides and free cholesterol were all significantly higher in the MOSF-3 .5 Fat group , while cholesterol esters were lower with MOSF than with S.
label: result

string: The area under the curve of total bilirubin was significantly lower with MOSF than with S.
label: result

string: Of 163 patients assessed for eligibility , 104 patients were randomly assigned to receive placebo , 2 mg of terazosin twice daily , 2 mg of tolterodine daily , or both terazosin plus tolterodine during the stenting period .
label: method

string: Prior to stenting and at stent removal , the International Prostate Symptom Score ( IPSS ) , the IPSS quality of life ( QoL ) subscore and the Visual Analog Scale for Pain were determined .
label: method

string: The patients also reported their analgesic use during the stenting period .
label: method

string: Ninety-four patients completed the study .
label: result

string: We noted significant decreases in the total IPSS scores ( p = 0.002 ) , irritative subscore ( p = 0.039 ) , QoL ( p = 0.001 ) , flank pain ( p = 0.013 ) , voiding pain ( p = 0.01 ) and amount of analgesics used ( p = 0.02 ) in the groups .
label: result

string: However , neither the obstructive subscore nor the suprapubic pain improved significantly ( p = 0.251 and p = 0.522 , respectively ) .
label: result

string: The patients receiving terazosin plus tolterodine experienced significant reductions in the total IPSS , irritative symptoms , QoL , flank pain , voiding pain and decreased analgesics use compared with those patients receiving placebo .
label: result

string: However , compared with placebo , terazosin monotherapy did not affect pain levels , and tolterodine monotherapy did not improve QoL , flank pain or analgesics use .
label: result

string: In two of three phase 3 trials , pirfenidone , an oral antifibrotic therapy , reduced disease progression , as measured by the decline in forced vital capacity ( FVC ) or vital capacity , in patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis ; in the third trial , this end point was not achieved .
label: background

string: We sought to confirm the beneficial effect of pirfenidone on disease progression in such patients .
label: background

string: In this phase 3 study , we randomly assigned 555 patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis to receive either oral pirfenidone ( 2403 mg per day ) or placebo for 52 weeks .
label: method

string: The primary end point was the change in FVC or death at week 52 .
label: method

string: Secondary end points were the 6-minute walk distance , progression-free survival , dyspnea , and death from any cause or from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis .
label: method

string: In the pirfenidone group , as compared with the placebo group , there was a relative reduction of 47.9 % in the proportion of patients who had an absolute decline of 10 percentage points or more in the percentage of the predicted FVC or who died ; there was also a relative increase of 132.5 % in the proportion of patients with no decline in FVC ( P < 0.001 ) .
label: result

string: Pirfenidone reduced the decline in the 6-minute walk distance ( P = 0.04 ) and improved progression-free survival ( P < 0.001 ) .
label: result

string: There was no significant between-group difference in dyspnea scores ( P = 0.16 ) or in rates of death from any cause ( P = 0.10 ) or from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis ( P = 0.23 ) .
label: result

string: However , in a prespecified pooled analysis incorporating results from two previous phase 3 trials , the between-group difference favoring pirfenidone was significant for death from any cause ( P = 0.01 ) and from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis ( P = 0.006 ) .
label: result

string: Gastrointestinal and skin-related adverse events were more common in the pirfenidone group than in the placebo group but rarely led to treatment discontinuation .
label: result

string: Eligibility required pathologic stage III to IV SCCHN with gross total resection showing positive margins and/or extracapsular nodal extension and/or two or more nodal metastases .
label: method

string: Patients were randomly assigned to 60 Gy radiation with cetuximab once per week plus either cisplatin 30 mg/m ( 2 ) or docetaxel 15 mg/m ( 2 ) once per week .
label: method

string: Between April 2004 and December 2006 , 238 patients were enrolled .
label: result

string: With a median follow-up of 4.4 years , 2-year overall survival ( OS ) was 69 % for the cisplatin arm and 79 % for the docetaxel arm ; 2-year disease-free survival ( DFS ) was 57 % and 66 % , respectively .
label: result

string: Patients with p16-positive oropharynx tumors showed markedly improved survival outcome relative to patients with p16-negative oropharynx tumors .
label: result

string: Grade 3 to 4 myelosuppression was observed in 28 % of patients in the cisplatin arm and 14 % in the docetaxel arm ; mucositis was observed in 56 % and 54 % , respectively .
label: result

string: DFS in this study was compared with that in the chemoradiotherapy arm of the RTOG-9501 trial ( Phase III Intergroup Trial of Surgery Followed by Radiotherapy Versus Radiochemotherapy for Resectable High Risk Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck ) , which had a hazard ratio of 0.76 for the cisplatin arm versus control ( P = .05 ) and 0.69 for the docetaxel arm versus control ( P = .01 ) , reflecting absolute improvement in 2-year DFS of 2.5 % and 11.1 % , respectively .
label: result

string: The use of mobile phone technologies for health promotion and disease prevention has advanced rapidly in recent years .
label: background

string: Text4baby is a theory-based mobile health ( mHealth ) program in which text messages are delivered to pregnant women and new mothers to improve their health care beliefs and behaviors and improve health status and clinical outcomes .
label: background

string: Recent evaluations of Text4baby have found that it improves targeted health attitudes and beliefs , but effects on behavior have not yet been determined .
label: background

string: Investigators conducted a randomized controlled trial at Madigan Army Medical Center in Tacoma , Washington , from December 2011 through September 2013 .
label: method

string: All participants were pregnant women first presenting for care at Madigan .
label: method

string: Investigators conducted a baseline assessment using a 24-item , self-administered online survey of attitudes and behaviors related to Text4baby message content .
label: method

string: Participants were randomized to Text4baby plus usual care ( intervention ) or usual care alone ( control ) .
label: method

string: Investigators analyzed treatment effects of Text4baby on short-term targeted outcomes 4 weeks post enrollment .
label: method

string: For this study , 943 patients were randomized and completed a baseline assessment .
label: result

string: The average patient age was 28 years and nearly 70 % self-identified as Caucasian .
label: result

string: 48.7 % of enrollees ( 459/943 ) completed the first follow-up assessment .
label: result

string: Higher rates of single and working/in-school patients dropped out of the intervention arm of the study , and we adjusted for this finding in subsequent models .
label: result

string: However , while investigators were unable to re-survey these participants , only 1.9 % of Text4baby enrollees ( 18/943 ) dropped the service during the study period .
label: result

string: Adjusted and unadjusted logistic generalized estimating equation models were developed to assess intervention effects on measured outcomes .
label: result

string: In the model adjusting for age , marital status , having had a previous baby , and race/ethnicity , there was a significant effect of Text4baby intervention exposure on increased agreement with belief in the importance of taking prenatal vitamins ( OR 1.91 , 95 % CI 1.08-3 .34 , P = .024 ) .
label: result

string: All of these attitudes had been targeted by at least one text message during the 4-week evaluation period examined in this study .
label: result

string: In unadjusted models , there was a significant effect of intervention exposure on belief in the importance of visiting a health care provider to be a healthy new mother ( OR 1.52 , 95 % CI 1.01-2 .31 , P = .046 ) and in the health risks of alcohol during pregnancy ( OR 2.06 , 95 % CI 1.00-4 .31 , P = .05 ) .
label: result

string: No behavioral effects of the intervention were observed in this analysis .
label: result

string: Because of ongoing controversy , renal and vital outcomes are compared between systemically administered unfractionated heparin and regional anticoagulation with citrate-buffered replacement solution in predilution mode , during continuous venovenous hemofiltration ( CVVH ) in critically ill patients with acute kidney injury ( AKI ) .
label: background

string: In this multi-center randomized controlled trial , patients admitted to the intensive care unit requiring CVVH and meeting inclusion criteria , were randomly assigned to citrate or heparin .
label: method

string: Primary endpoints were mortality and renal outcome in intention-to-treat analysis .
label: method

string: Secondary endpoints were safety and efficacy .
label: method

string: Safety was defined as absence of any adverse event necessitating discontinuation of the assigned anticoagulant .
label: method

string: For efficacy , among other parameters , survival times of the first hemofilter were studied .
label: method

string: Of the 139 patients enrolled , 66 were randomized to citrate and 73 to heparin .
label: result

string: Mortality rates at 28 and 90 days did not differ between groups : 22/66 ( 33 % ) of citrate-treated patients died versus 25/72 ( 35 % ) of heparin-treated patients at 28 days , and 27/65 ( 42 % ) of citrate-treated patients died versus 29/69 ( 42 % ) of heparin-treated patients at 90 days ( P = 1.00 for both ) .
label: result

string: Renal outcome , i.e. independency of renal replacement therapy 28 days after initiation of CVVH in surviving patients , did not differ between groups : 29/43 ( 67 % ) in the citrate-treated patients versus 33/47 ( 70 % ) in heparin-treated patients ( P = 0.82 ) .
label: result

string: Heparin was discontinued in 24/73 ( 33 % ) of patients whereas citrate was discontinued in 5/66 ( 8 % ) of patients ( P < 0.001 ) .
label: result

string: Filter survival times were superior for citrate ( median 46 versus 32 hours , P = 0.02 ) , as were the number of filters used ( P = 0.002 ) and the off time within 72 hours ( P = 0.002 ) .
label: result

string: The costs during the first 72 hours of prescribed CVVH were lower in citrate-based CVVH .
label: result

string: Clinicaltrials.gov NCT00209378 .
label: background

string: Registered 13th September 2005 .
label: background

string: Sixty patients between 20 and 60 years of age were included in this prospective , randomized , double-blind study .
label: method

string: Patients in Group I received placebo , Group II patients received preoperative oral acetazolamide ( 5mg/kg ) , and Group III patients received intraperitoneal irrigation with 30mL/kg of normal saline .
label: method

string: Intravenous paracetamol ( 1g ) was administered every 6 hours for postoperative analgesia .
label: method

string: Parietal and visceral pain scores at rest , on movement , and on coughing and shoulder tip pain were recorded using a visual analog scale after arrival in the postanesthesia care unit , at 1 , 2 , 4 , 6 , 12 , and 24 hours after surgery .
label: method

string: Rescue analgesia was provided with an intravenous fentanyl ( 1g/kg ) bolus whenever the visual analog scale score was 4 .
label: method

string: Compared with Group I , Group III patients had significantly lower visceral pain scores at all time intervals except at 12 hours .
label: result

string: Group III patients also recorded significantly lower visceral pain scores than Group II from 2 to 24 hours .
label: result

string: There was no significant difference in shoulder tip pain .
label: result

string: The total dose of fentanyl used was significantly less in Group III .
label: result
